required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Assessment of Physiotherapy Practice Validation as a Measure in Physiotherapy Student
clinical_study.official_title: Validity and Reliability of the Assessment of Physiotherapy Practice Validation as a Measure in Physiotherapy Student

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to determine the reliability and validity of the assesment of physiotherapy practice (APP) in physiotherapy students. Concretely the study aims to verify if the APP created by the professors of specific methods of intervention in physiotherapy course is a reliable tool to evaluate student performance of history taking and physical examination in the same course.

primary_outcome.description: Validity and reliability of the Assessment of Physiotherapy Practice tool with a total of 10 point valoration

study_pop.textblock: Students of the specific methods of intervention in physiotherapy course of Catholic University of Murcia, Spain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- students of specific methods of intervention in physiotherapy course
- students of Catholic University of Murcia, Spain
- with a minimum of 19 years old
- in the second course of physiotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- other courses participants
- professors
- segretary

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
